Allison Hecht and Grant Steven Held were married last evening by Rabbi David M. Posner at the Lotos Club in New York.
Mrs. Held, 37, is the director of new business at the Rockwell Group, the architecture and design firm in New York. She graduated from Harvard.

She is the daughter of Gail Cooper-Hecht of New York and the late Herbert E. Hecht. Her mother is a costume designer who has worked on more than two dozen Off Broadway plays. Her father was a music director and conductor for national tours of Broadway musicals.
The bride's previous marriage ended in divorce.
Mr. Held, 40, is a vice president for business development at the Engel Burman Group, a real estate development company in Lynbrook, N.Y. He graduated from Tufts.

He is the son of Phyllis and Dino Held of Freeport, N.Y. His mother is the office manager for an orthodontist in Rockville Centre, N.Y. His father, who is retired, was the manager of passenger service for Alitalia at Kennedy Airport.
